column4: Hi all, I need to know a way to re-generate the original /etc/X11/xorg.conf that is created at ubuntu install time. I am testing hardy and lost my xorg.conf. dpkg-reconfigure -plow is not the answer since the file it generates does not contain the stuff for wacom tablet
Keigo-kin
nobody knows how to regenerate the default xorg.conf without re-installing
Come on I destroyed mine to reply to a bug report question :)
dont think thats possible unless you backed it up yourself, just try to set it up using generic values, what are you trying to do anyway
what is the tool that generates it in principle?
how can you destroy x replying to a bug report?
I had to check the "new" configuration tools
this aint DBZ (regenerate) you have to use the command for X to set it up manually
I have now three or four xorg.conf with different extensions and don't know what the original one is
so you have backups than?
you mean X -config or something like that?
I am not completely sure
yea x-config and if you are not sure it means you created those yourself so dont bother
because I thought my backup was xorg.conf.1 (generated by the screen settings configuration) but it is not working the same
I hope this helps you https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/4273 that is if you have a valid backup
I restricted my attention to two backups (I remembered about a keyword that I had set up some time ago)
so if none of them works again, it's fault of today's X updates
if the link helps try that or reconfigure xorg yourself
or I will just start the livecd and copy the xorg.conf file... what a dumb :)
didn't realize it's that easy
thanks for your help
that could work would never think of that, nice thinking outside the box *im amused*
